Sockeye salmon migrating to sea in years with strong evidence for human effects on temperature produce catches 1.4 standard deviations below the long-term log mean. Representing 'Year with strong evidence' with a placeholder year 2000
Largest annual SST anomaly to date of any of the regions considered. This is the year the paper was published. Assuming the observation is from the most recent year.
Decline in raw catch relative to years with FAR between 0.33 and 0.91. Relates to years 2017-2022 where FAR = 0.98-0.99. Middle of the range is selected for the year.
All regions show increased Risk Ratios over time with significant spikes post-1980; precise value estimated from the graph.
Marked increase in risk after 1980 with notable peaks near 2010; strong human influence on SST in this region.
Spikes in risk ratio between 1980 and 2020, particularly around 1990 and 2010; affected by human-caused warming.
Increase beginning around 1980; less pronounced but still noted.
Significant rises in risk ratio beginning around 1980.
More pronounced rises around 2000 and 2015; consistent increases since 1980.
